bioghist.p: Robert S. Pressman (1911-1995) graduated from the Temple University School of Medicine in 1946 and received an M.M.S. degree in Internal Medicine from the University of Pennsylvania. Pressman served as an Associate Professor of Medicine at Temple University and as head of the infectious diseases section at the Albert Einstein Medical Center. He was a president of the Philadelphia County Medical Society and of the Pennsylvania Society of Internal Medicine (1968-1969). He also served as president of the medical staff at Albert Einstein Medical Center. Pressman was elected a fellow of the College of Physicians in 1955. He served as president of the College of Physicians from 1984 to 1986. He also served on several College committees, including the Committees on Audit, Fellowship, Finance, Major Gifts, and Nominations, and he was also an S. Weir Mitchell Associate and an active supporter of the New Century Fund.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Robert S. Pressman. Materials include: records of Pressman's term as President of the College of Physicians including correspondence, minutes and reports, and financial information; correspondence, minutes and reports, memoranda, policy statements, and annual reports, from the Philadelphia County Medical Society, the Pennsylvania Medical Society, and the Albert Einstein Medical Center; lecture notes from Pressman's medical studies at Temple University; product catalogs for medical equipment and supplies; bills and receipts; articles, reprints and journals; notes on research studies; grant proposals; correspondence with colleagues, editors, and patients.; and awards, certificates, and diplomas. The collection also includes a small amount of materials related to Pressman and his wife's military service, including patient records; family papers including a Pressman family history, school records of Alice Pressman, and photographs several diaries; and also medical textbooks.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
